#Text=The Lovely Lady of Light
#Text=The palace of the Queen of Light stood on a little eminence and was a mass of crystal windows , surmounted by a vast crystal dome .
#Text=When they entered the portals Erma was greeted by six lovely maidens , evidently of high degree , who at once aroused Betsy 's admiration .
#Text=Each bore a wand in her hand , tipped with an emblem of light , and their costumes were also emblematic of the lights they represented .
#Text=Erma introduced them to her guests and each made a graceful and courteous acknowledgment .

#Text=First was Sunlight , radiantly beautiful and very fair ; the second was Moonlight , a soft , dreamy damsel with nut-brown hair ; next came Starlight , equally lovely but inclined to be retiring and shy .
#Text=These three were dressed in shimmering robes of silvery white .
#Text=The fourth was Daylight , a brilliant damsel with laughing eyes and frank manners , who wore a variety of colors .
#Text=Then came Firelight , clothed in a fleecy flame-colored robe that wavered around her shapely form in a very attractive manner .
#Text=The sixth maiden , Electra , was the most beautiful of all , and Betsy thought from the first that both Sunlight and Daylight regarded Electra with envy and were a little jealous of her .

#Text=But all were cordial in their greetings to the strangers and seemed to regard the Queen of Light with much affection , for they fluttered around her in a flashing , radiant group as she led the way to her regal drawing-room .

#Text=This apartment was richly and cosily furnished , the upholstery being of many tints , and both Betsy and Polychrome enjoyed resting themselves upon the downy divans after their strenuous adventures of the day .
#Text=The Queen sat down to chat with her guests , who noticed that Daylight was the only maiden now seated beside Erma .
#Text=The others had retired to another part of the room , where they sat modestly with entwined arms and did not intrude themselves at all .
#Text=The Queen told the strangers all about this beautiful land , which is one of the chief residences of fairies who minister to the needs of mankind .

#Text=So many important fairies lived there that , to avoid rivalry , they had elected as their Ruler the only important personage in the country who had no duties to mankind to perform and was , in effect , a Private Citizen .
#Text=This Ruler , or Jinjin , as was his title , bore the name of Tititi-Hoochoo , and the most singular thing about him was that he had no heart .
#Text=But instead of this he possessed a high degree of Reason and Justice and while he showed no mercy in his judgments he never punished unjustly or without reason .
#Text=To wrong-doers Tititi-Hoochoo was as terrible as he was heartless , but those who were innocent of evil had nothing to fear from him .
#Text=All the Kings and Queens of this fairyland paid reverence to Jinjin , for as they expected to be obeyed by others they were willing to obey the one in authority over them .
#Text=The inhabitants of the Land of Oz had heard many tales of this fearfully just Jinjin , whose punishments were always equal to the faults committed .
#Text=Polychrome also knew of him , although this was the first time she had ever seen him face to face .
#Text=But to Betsy the story was all new , and she was greatly interested in Tititi-Hoochoo , whom she no longer feared .
#Text=Time sped swiftly during their talk and suddenly
#Text=Betsy noticed that Moonlight was sitting beside the Queen of Light , instead of Daylight .
#Text="

#Text=But tell me , please ,  she pleaded , " why do you all wear a dragon 's head embroidered on your gowns ?

#Text= The Dragon , as you must know , was the first living creature ever made ; therefore the Dragon is the oldest and wisest of living things .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Did he ever have any children ?

_	_	_	_

#Text= I understand about the dragon , now , " said Polychrome , nodding her lovely head .

column1: #Text=Betsy did not quite understand , but she was at present interested in observing the changing lights .
#Text=As Daylight had given way to Moonlight , so now Starlight sat at the right hand of Erma the Queen , and with her coming a spirit of peace and content seemed to fill the room .

#Text=Polychrome , being herself a fairy , had many questions to ask about the various Kings and Queens who lived in this far-away , secluded place , and before Erma had finished answering them a rosy glow filled the room and Firelight took her place beside the Queen .
#Text=Betsy liked Firelight , but to gaze upon her warm and glowing features made the little girl sleepy , and presently she began to nod .
#Text=Thereupon Erma rose and took Betsy 's hand gently in her own .
